metadata.title: AWS Cloud Practitioner CLF-C02 Practice Questions

questions.question: Which of the following best describes cloud computing?
options: Purchasing physical servers for your company's data center
On-demand delivery of IT resources over the internet with pay-as-you-go pricing
Using a dedicated private network without internet access
Running applications on a local desktop computer
questions.explanation: Cloud computing is the on-demand delivery of IT resources such as compute, storage, and databases over the internet with pay-as-you-go pricing, eliminating the need to own and maintain physical data centers.

questions.question: What is a key financial benefit of using AWS Cloud compared to on-premises infrastructure?
options: Increased need for data center staff
Trading fixed expenses for variable expenses
questions.explanation: AWS allows companies to trade capital expense (CapEx) for variable operational expense (OpEx). You only pay for what you consume rather than investing heavily in data centers before knowing how you will use them.

questions.question: Which advantage of cloud computing refers to the ability to acquire resources as needed and release them when no longer required?
questions.explanation: Elasticity is the ability to acquire resources when you need them and release them when you no longer need them. In the cloud, you can scale resources up or down quickly to match demand.

questions.question: A company wants to reduce the time it takes to deploy new applications from weeks to minutes. Which cloud benefit does this describe?
questions.explanation: Agility refers to the speed at which cloud resources can be provisioned and deployed. AWS enables companies to spin up resources in minutes rather than waiting weeks for hardware procurement and setup.

questions.question: Which cloud computing model provides the customer with the MOST control over the underlying infrastructure?
questions.explanation: IaaS provides the most control because the customer manages the operating system, middleware, runtime, and applications. The cloud provider only manages the physical hardware and virtualization layer.

questions.question: Amazon RDS is an example of which cloud service model?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is a PaaS offering because AWS manages the underlying infrastructure, operating system, and database engine patching, while the customer manages the data and application-level configuration.

questions.question: A company runs an application on Amazon EC2 and is responsible for patching the guest operating system. Which cloud deployment model does this represent?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 is an IaaS offering. With IaaS, the customer is responsible for managing and patching the guest OS, while AWS manages the host OS and physical infrastructure.

questions.question: Which cloud deployment model runs infrastructure entirely within a company's own data center using cloud-like technologies?
questions.explanation: A private cloud (on-premises) deployment uses virtualization and cloud management tools within the company's own data center. It provides cloud-like capabilities but does not offer the same benefits as the public cloud.

questions.question: A company wants to keep sensitive data on-premises while using AWS for scalable web-facing workloads. Which deployment strategy is MOST appropriate?
questions.explanation: A hybrid cloud deployment connects on-premises infrastructure to the AWS public cloud. This allows the company to keep sensitive data on-premises while leveraging AWS scalability for other workloads.

questions.question: Which AWS service facilitates a hybrid cloud deployment by extending AWS infrastructure to on-premises locations?
questions.explanation: AWS Outposts delivers AWS infrastructure and services to virtually any on-premises location, enabling a truly consistent hybrid experience with the same APIs, tools, and hardware used in the AWS Cloud.

questions.question: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on the ability to recover from failures and meet demand?
questions.explanation: The Reliability pillar focuses on ensuring a workload performs its intended function correctly and consistently, including the ability to recover from failures and dynamically acquire resources to meet demand.

questions.question: How many pillars does the AWS Well-Architected Framework have?
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Framework has six pillars: Operational Excellence, Security, Reliability, Performance Efficiency, Cost Optimization, and Sustainability.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected Framework pillar includes the practice of performing operations as code and making frequent, small, reversible changes?
questions.explanation: Operational Excellence focuses on running and monitoring systems to deliver business value and continually improving processes. Key practices include performing operations as code, making frequent small reversible changes, and learning from operational events.

questions.question: What does 'pay-as-you-go' pricing mean in AWS?
options: You must pay for a minimum of one year
You receive a bill at the end of the year
You pay only for the resources you actually consume
You pay a fixed monthly fee regardless of usage
questions.explanation: Pay-as-you-go means you only pay for the individual services you use, for as long as you use them. There are no long-term contracts or upfront commitments required for most services.

questions.question: Which benefit of cloud computing allows AWS to achieve lower variable costs than customers could on their own?
questions.explanation: Because AWS aggregates usage from hundreds of thousands of customers, it achieves higher economies of scale, which translates into lower pay-as-you-go prices for individual customers.

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of moving to the AWS Cloud?
options: You need to guess your future capacity needs
You gain full physical access to AWS data centers
You can stop spending money on data center operations
questions.explanation: By moving to AWS, companies can stop spending money running and maintaining data centers. AWS handles the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers, letting customers focus on their core business.

questions.question: Which cloud service model requires the customer to manage ONLY the application and its data?
questions.explanation: With PaaS, the cloud provider manages the infrastructure, operating system, and runtime. The customer only needs to manage the application code and data, reducing operational overhead.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected Framework pillar was added most recently and focuses on minimizing the environmental impacts of running cloud workloads?
questions.explanation: The Sustainability pillar was the most recently added (sixth) pillar. It focuses on minimizing the environmental impacts of running cloud workloads, including energy consumption and resource efficiency.

questions.question: What allows AWS customers to deploy applications in multiple geographic areas around the world quickly?
questions.explanation: The AWS Global Infrastructure, composed of Regions and Availability Zones worldwide, enables customers to deploy applications closer to their end users with just a few clicks, reducing latency and improving the user experience.

questions.question: Which deployment model uses ONLY cloud-based resources with no on-premises infrastructure?
questions.explanation: A cloud-native (public cloud) deployment means all components of the application run entirely in the cloud. There is no on-premises infrastructure involved, which maximizes the benefits of cloud computing.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected Framework pillar is primarily concerned with protecting data, systems, and assets?
questions.explanation: The Security pillar focuses on protecting information and systems. Key areas include identity and access management, detective controls, infrastructure protection, data protection, and incident response.

questions.question: A startup wants to avoid large upfront investments in hardware. Which cloud computing advantage addresses this concern?
options: Trade capital expense for variable expense
questions.explanation: Cloud computing allows startups to trade large capital expenses (buying servers) for smaller variable expenses (paying only for consumption). This eliminates the need for heavy upfront investments.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected Framework pillar includes the design principle of using serverless architectures and selecting the right resource types based on workload requirements?
questions.explanation: Performance Efficiency focuses on using computing resources efficiently to meet requirements and maintaining efficiency as demand changes and technologies evolve. This includes selecting the right resource types and using serverless architectures.

questions.question: A company needs to quickly scale its infrastructure during a product launch and scale back down afterward. Which TWO cloud advantages are MOST relevant?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows the company to scale resources up during the launch and back down afterward. Agility allows these changes to happen rapidly rather than waiting weeks for hardware provisioning.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a SaaS service?
questions.explanation: Amazon WorkDocs is a SaaS service that provides fully managed document collaboration and storage. The customer does not manage any infrastructure; they simply use the application through a web browser.

questions.question: Which Well-Architected pillar emphasizes right-sizing resources, using managed services, and analyzing spending over time?
questions.explanation: Cost Optimization focuses on avoiding unnecessary costs by understanding spending, selecting the right resource types and sizes, using managed services to reduce cost of ownership, and analyzing expenditures over time.

questions.question: What is a benefit of running workloads across multiple AWS Availability Zones?
options: Faster internet speeds for end users
Increased application availability and fault tolerance
questions.explanation: Running workloads across multiple Availability Zones provides high availability and fault tolerance. If one AZ experiences an outage, the application can continue running in another AZ with minimal disruption.

questions.question: A healthcare company must store patient data in a specific country due to regulations but wants to use AWS for analytics workloads. Which strategy is BEST?
options: Deploy everything in the nearest AWS Region regardless of regulations
Use AWS but disable all data encryption
Use only on-premises infrastructure for all workloads
Use a hybrid cloud approach with patient data on-premises and analytics in AWS
questions.explanation: A hybrid cloud approach allows the healthcare company to keep regulated patient data on-premises to comply with data residency requirements while leveraging AWS cloud resources for analytics, gaining scalability and cost benefits.

questions.question: Which statement BEST describes the concept of 'stop guessing capacity' as a cloud benefit?
options: You never need to monitor resource utilization
You can provision exactly the resources you need and scale on demand
AWS will automatically fix application bugs
AWS guarantees 100% uptime for all services
questions.explanation: In the cloud, you no longer need to guess your infrastructure capacity needs. You can access as much or as little capacity as you need and scale up or down as required, often within minutes.

questions.question: A company uses Amazon EC2 instances and manages the OS, middleware, and applications. However, they want to move to a model where they only manage the application code. Which service model should they adopt?
questions.explanation: Moving from IaaS (EC2) to PaaS would allow the company to stop managing the OS and middleware. With PaaS, the provider handles everything except the application code and data.

questions.question: What AWS tool helps evaluate workloads against the Well-Architected Framework best practices?
questions.explanation: The AWS Well-Architected Tool is a free service that helps you review the state of your workloads against the six pillars of the Well-Architected Framework and provides recommendations for improvement.

questions.question: Which scenario demonstrates the cloud benefit of 'going global in minutes'?
options: A company signs a multi-year contract with AWS for discounted pricing
A company uses AWS IAM to create user accounts
A company migrates its on-premises database to Amazon RDS
A company deploys its application to AWS Regions in Asia, Europe, and North America using CloudFormation templates
questions.explanation: Going global in minutes means you can deploy your application across multiple AWS Regions around the world quickly using tools like CloudFormation. This provides lower latency and a better experience for global customers.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of cloud computing?
options: Benefit from massive economies of scale
Stop spending money running data centers
questions.explanation: While cloud computing provides many benefits, it does not eliminate all security responsibilities. Under the shared responsibility model, customers still have security responsibilities such as managing access, encrypting data, and configuring firewalls.

questions.question: Which term describes using services from multiple cloud providers simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Multi-cloud refers to using services from two or more cloud providers (e.g., AWS and Azure) simultaneously. This differs from hybrid cloud, which combines on-premises with cloud infrastructure.

questions.question: A company's Well-Architected review reveals their application has a single point of failure. Which pillar's recommendations should they follow to address this?
questions.explanation: The Reliability pillar addresses the ability of a system to recover from disruptions and meet availability requirements. Eliminating single points of failure through redundancy is a key Reliability design principle.

questions.question: Which of the following is a design principle recommended by AWS for cloud architectures?
options: Design for failure and implement automated recovery
Minimize the use of managed services
Design for fixed capacity to save costs
questions.explanation: AWS recommends designing for failure because components can and will fail. Implementing automated recovery mechanisms ensures that applications remain available and recover quickly from disruptions.

questions.question: Under the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is the CUSTOMER's responsibility?
questions.explanation: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, the customer is responsible for security 'in' the cloud, which includes managing IAM user permissions, access controls, and identity management. AWS handles the physical and infrastructure layers.

questions.question: Which of the following is AWS responsible for under the Shared Responsibility Model?
options: Physical security of data center facilities
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for security 'of' the cloud, which includes the physical security of the facilities that house AWS services, including access controls, environmental protections, and power management.

questions.question: What is AWS IAM used for?
options: Managing access to AWS services and resources
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a service that helps you securely control access to AWS services and resources. You can create and manage users, groups, roles, and their permissions.

questions.question: Which IAM feature should be enabled for the AWS root account to enhance security?
questions.explanation: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) should be enabled on the root account as a security best practice. MFA adds an extra layer of protection by requiring a second form of authentication beyond just the password.

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for granting permissions in AWS IAM?
options: Share IAM credentials between team members
Follow the principle of least privilege
Grant all permissions to all users for ease of use
Only use the root account for daily operations
questions.explanation: The principle of least privilege states that you should grant only the minimum permissions needed to perform a task. This reduces the risk of accidental or intentional misuse of permissions.

questions.question: Which IAM entity is BEST used to grant temporary access to AWS resources for applications running on EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: IAM roles provide temporary security credentials for applications or services that need to access AWS resources. Attaching an IAM role to an EC2 instance is more secure than storing access keys on the instance.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides DDoS protection?
questions.explanation: AWS Shield provides DDoS protection. AWS Shield Standard is automatically enabled at no cost, while AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced protections, 24/7 DDoS response team access, and cost protection against DDoS-related scaling.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a web application firewall that helps protect web applications from common exploits like SQL injection and cross-site scripting?
questions.explanation: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) lets you create rules that block common web exploits like SQL injection and cross-site scripting. It can be deployed on Amazon CloudFront, Application Load Balancer, or API Gateway.

questions.question: Which AWS service continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior by analyzing CloudTrail logs, VPC Flow Logs, and DNS logs?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that uses machine learning and anomaly detection to continuously monitor and analyze AWS account activity from CloudTrail, VPC Flow Logs, and DNS logs to identify potential threats.

questions.question: Which AWS service records API calls made on your account and delivers log files for auditing?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records API calls made on your account, including who made the call, what services were called, and when. These logs are essential for governance, compliance, operational auditing, and risk auditing.

questions.question: In the Shared Responsibility Model, who is responsible for patching the guest operating system on an Amazon EC2 instance?
options: Both AWS and the customer equally
questions.explanation: The customer is responsible for patching the guest OS on EC2 instances. Under the shared responsibility model, the customer manages the guest OS, application software, and configuration of AWS-provided security groups and firewalls.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps you assess whether your AWS resources comply with your organization's policies and standards?
questions.explanation: AWS Config provides a detailed view of the configuration of AWS resources and continuously evaluates resource configurations against desired settings. It can alert you when resources drift from compliance.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Amazon Inspector?
options: Assessing applications for vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices
questions.explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS. It automatically assesses applications for vulnerabilities or deviations from best practices.

questions.question: A company has multiple AWS accounts and wants to centrally manage access permissions across all accounts. Which service should they use?
options: AWS Organizations with Service Control Policies (SCPs)
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts. Service Control Policies (SCPs) let you set permission guardrails that apply across all accounts in the organization, providing centralized access control.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to manage encryption keys used to encrypt your data?
questions.explanation: AWS KMS is a managed service that makes it easy to create and control the encryption keys used to encrypt your data. KMS integrates with most AWS services that support encryption.

questions.question: Under the Shared Responsibility Model, who is responsible for patching the database engine when using Amazon RDS?
questions.explanation: With Amazon RDS (a managed service), AWS is responsible for patching the database engine and the underlying operating system. The customer is responsible for managing their data, query optimization, and network access controls.

questions.question: Which AWS service uses machine learning to automatically discover, classify, and protect sensitive data such as personally identifiable information (PII) stored in Amazon S3?
questions.explanation: Amazon Macie uses machine learning and pattern matching to discover and protect sensitive data stored in S3 buckets. It can identify PII, financial data, and other sensitive content and alert you to potential data exposure risks.

questions.question: What is the purpose of an IAM policy?
options: To define permissions that allow or deny access to AWS resources
questions.explanation: IAM policies are JSON documents that define permissions. They specify which actions are allowed or denied on which AWS resources and under what conditions, controlling what users, groups, and roles can do.

questions.question: Which IAM best practice involves creating individual accounts for each person who needs access rather than sharing credentials?
questions.explanation: Creating individual IAM users for each person ensures accountability and traceability. Each user has unique credentials and permissions, making it easy to audit actions and revoke access when needed.

questions.question: Where can customers find AWS compliance reports and certifications such as SOC and ISO reports?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact is a self-service portal that provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports, certifications, and agreements such as SOC reports, ISO certifications, and BAAs.

questions.question: A company needs to store and automatically rotate database credentials, API keys, and other secrets. Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: AWS Secrets Manager helps you store, retrieve, and automatically rotate secrets such as database credentials, API keys, and tokens. It eliminates the need to hardcode secrets in application code.

questions.question: Which phrase BEST summarizes AWS's responsibility in the Shared Responsibility Model?
questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for 'security of the cloud,' meaning the infrastructure that runs all the services, including hardware, software, networking, and the physical facilities. Customers handle 'security in the cloud.'

questions.question: Which AWS service provides managed SSL/TLS certificates for use with AWS services and internal resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) handles the provisioning, management, and deployment of SSL/TLS certificates. ACM certificates are free for use with supported AWS services like Elastic Load Balancing and CloudFront.

questions.question: A company wants to allow users to sign in with their corporate Active Directory credentials to access the AWS Management Console. Which service enables this?
questions.explanation: AWS IAM Identity Center (formerly AWS SSO) enables single sign-on access to AWS accounts and business applications. It can integrate with corporate Active Directory to allow users to sign in with their existing credentials.

questions.question: For which service does the Shared Responsibility Model shift MORE responsibility to AWS compared to Amazon EC2?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless service where AWS manages the compute infrastructure, OS, and runtime. Compared to EC2 (where the customer manages the OS), Lambda shifts more responsibility to AWS, leaving the customer responsible only for code and data.

questions.question: Which feature of Amazon S3 helps protect data by enabling you to recover from accidental deletions?
questions.explanation: S3 Versioning keeps multiple variants of an object in the same bucket. If you accidentally delete or overwrite an object, you can recover a previous version, protecting against unintended data loss.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a central location to manage compliance requirements and continuously audit your AWS usage?
questions.explanation: AWS Audit Manager helps you continuously audit your AWS usage to simplify risk assessment and compliance with regulations and industry standards. It automates evidence collection and manages audit workflows.

questions.question: A company uses Amazon S3 to store data. Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is the CUSTOMER's responsibility?
options: Ensuring the durability of data stored in S3
Configuring bucket policies and access controls
questions.explanation: When using S3, the customer is responsible for configuring access controls, bucket policies, and encryption settings for their data. AWS is responsible for the underlying infrastructure, durability, and availability of the S3 service itself.

questions.question: Which network security feature acts as a virtual firewall at the subnet level in an Amazon VPC?
questions.explanation: Network ACLs operate at the subnet level and act as a firewall for controlling traffic in and out of subnets. Unlike security groups which are stateful, NACLs are stateless and evaluate both inbound and outbound rules separately.

questions.question: Which network security feature acts as a virtual firewall at the instance level?
questions.explanation: Security groups act as a virtual firewall at the instance level, controlling inbound and outbound traffic. They are stateful, meaning if you allow inbound traffic, the response traffic is automatically allowed.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides identity management for web and mobile applications, allowing features like user sign-up and social login?
questions.explanation: Amazon Cognito provides identity management for web and mobile apps. It supports user sign-up, sign-in, and access control, and can integrate with social identity providers like Google, Facebook, and Apple.

questions.question: Which AWS program helps customers understand their compliance posture and provides access to compliance frameworks specific to their industry?
questions.explanation: AWS Compliance Programs provide information about AWS compliance certifications and attestations across various industries and geographies, helping customers understand the compliance controls in place for AWS services.

questions.question: Which type of encryption protects data while it is being transferred over a network?
questions.explanation: Encryption in transit protects data as it moves between systems, such as between a client and a server. AWS services support TLS/SSL for encrypting data in transit to prevent eavesdropping or man-in-the-middle attacks.

questions.question: Which AWS service aggregates security findings from multiple AWS services into a single dashboard and uses automated compliance checks?
questions.explanation: AWS Security Hub gives you a comprehensive view of your security state in AWS. It aggregates findings from services like GuardDuty, Inspector, Macie, and third-party tools into a single pane and runs automated compliance checks.

questions.question: Which statement about the AWS root account is TRUE?
options: It is the same as an IAM administrator user
It has unrestricted access to all resources and cannot be limited by IAM policies
It can be deleted after creating IAM users
It should be used for everyday administrative tasks
questions.explanation: The root account has complete, unrestricted access to all resources in the AWS account and cannot be limited by IAM policies. Best practice is to lock away root credentials and use IAM users for daily tasks.

questions.question: When using AWS Lambda, which of the following is the CUSTOMER's responsibility?
options: Securing the function code and configuring IAM execution roles
questions.explanation: With Lambda (serverless), AWS manages the infrastructure, OS, and runtime. The customer is responsible for their function code, IAM execution roles, and any data the function processes.

questions.question: What type of agreement can healthcare organizations find in AWS Artifact to comply with HIPAA?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides access to a Business Associate Addendum (BAA), which healthcare organizations need to sign with AWS to handle protected health information (PHI) in compliance with HIPAA regulations.

questions.question: Which type of AWS Shield is automatically provided to all AWS customers at no additional cost?
questions.explanation: AWS Shield Standard is automatically enabled for all AWS customers at no extra charge. It provides protection against the most common and frequently occurring DDoS attacks targeting your website or applications.

questions.question: An IAM policy has an explicit 'Deny' and an explicit 'Allow' for the same action. What is the result?
options: The action is allowed for IAM users but denied for IAM roles
The most recently created policy takes precedence
questions.explanation: In AWS IAM, an explicit Deny always takes precedence over an explicit Allow. This is a fundamental rule of IAM policy evaluation and ensures that restrictive policies cannot be overridden by permissive ones.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to establish a dedicated, private network connection between your on-premises data center and AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated, private network connection from your premises to AWS. This can reduce network costs, increase bandwidth throughput, and provide a more consistent network experience than internet-based connections.

questions.question: Which of the following is a customer responsibility regardless of which AWS service is being used?
questions.explanation: Regardless of the AWS service model, the customer is always responsible for protecting and managing their own data, including choosing whether and how to encrypt it. This applies to EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, and all other services.

questions.question: Which AWS service can detect potential security issues by continuously monitoring network activity and account behavior across your AWS environment?
questions.explanation: Amazon GuardDuty uses threat intelligence, machine learning, and anomaly detection to continuously monitor your AWS accounts, workloads, and data for malicious activity. It analyzes billions of events across multiple data sources.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps investigate and analyze the root cause of security findings or suspicious activities?
questions.explanation: Amazon Detective makes it easy to analyze, investigate, and quickly identify the root cause of potential security issues or suspicious activities. It automatically collects log data and uses machine learning to build visualizations.

questions.question: What is an IAM group used for?
options: Granting temporary credentials to external users
Organizing IAM users and applying permissions collectively
questions.explanation: An IAM group is a collection of IAM users. Policies attached to a group apply to all users in that group, making it easier to manage permissions for teams rather than assigning policies to each user individually.

questions.question: A company deploys a containerized application using Amazon ECS on AWS Fargate. Under the Shared Responsibility Model, which is the CUSTOMER's responsibility?
options: Securing the application code and managing task-level IAM roles
questions.explanation: With Fargate (serverless containers), AWS manages the underlying infrastructure and host OS. The customer is responsible for securing their container images, application code, and configuring task-level IAM roles and networking.

questions.question: What is an AWS Region?
options: A geographic area containing multiple isolated Availability Zones
questions.explanation: An AWS Region is a physical geographic area that contains multiple isolated and physically separate Availability Zones. Each Region is designed to be completely independent of other Regions for fault isolation.

questions.question: What is an Availability Zone (AZ) in AWS?
options: A logical grouping of AWS Regions
One or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity
questions.explanation: An Availability Zone consists of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity. AZs within a Region are connected through low-latency links but are physically separated for fault isolation.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides resizable virtual servers in the cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides resizable virtual servers (instances) in the cloud. You can choose the instance type, operating system, and configuration based on your workload requirements.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides object storage with virtually unlimited scalability?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is an object storage service that offers virtually unlimited scalability, high durability (99.999999999% or 11 nines), and data availability. It is designed to store and retrieve any amount of data.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to run code without provisioning or managing servers?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You pay only for the compute time you consume, and there is no charge when your code is not running.

questions.question: Which AWS database service is a fully managed relational database compatible with MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, and SQL Server?
questions.explanation: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) is a managed service that makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale relational databases in the cloud. It supports multiple database engines including MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, Oracle, and SQL Server.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a fully managed NoSQL database with single-digit millisecond performance?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database that provides consistent, single-digit millisecond latency at any scale. It supports key-value and document data models and is serverless with automatic scaling.

questions.question: Which AWS service is a content delivery network (CDN) that caches content at edge locations worldwide?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to viewers with low latency and high transfer speeds. It caches content at edge locations around the world to reduce latency for end users.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides managed DNS (Domain Name System) and can route traffic based on latency, geography, or health checks?
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 is a scalable DNS web service that can route end users to internet applications. It supports various routing policies including latency-based, geolocation, weighted, and failover routing.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to create an isolated virtual network in the AWS Cloud?
questions.explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch resources in a virtual network that you define, with full control over IP addressing, subnets, and routing.

questions.question: Which Amazon EC2 purchasing option provides the LARGEST discount (up to 72%) in exchange for a 1 or 3-year commitment?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances provide a significant discount (up to 72%) compared to On-Demand pricing in exchange for a commitment to a specific instance type in a particular Region for 1 or 3 years.

questions.question: Which EC2 purchasing option offers up to 90% discount but instances can be interrupted by AWS with a two-minute notice?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity at up to 90% discount. However, AWS can reclaim these instances with a two-minute warning, making them ideal for fault-tolerant and flexible workloads.

questions.question: A company needs to run a mission-critical database that requires a specific physical server for licensing compliance. Which EC2 option is MOST appropriate?
questions.explanation: Dedicated Hosts provide a physical server fully dedicated to your use. They are useful for meeting compliance requirements and using server-bound software licenses like per-socket or per-core licenses.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides monitoring and observability by collecting metrics, logs, and events from AWS resources?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch monitors AWS resources and applications in real time. It collects and tracks metrics, collects and monitors log files, sets alarms, and can automatically react to changes in your AWS resources.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps you provision infrastructure using code templates, enabling infrastructure as code?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to model and provision AWS resources using JSON or YAML templates. This infrastructure-as-code approach ensures consistent, repeatable deployments and makes it easy to version-control your infrastructure.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides block-level storage volumes for use with Amazon EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Amazon EBS (Elastic Block Store) provides persistent block-level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances. EBS volumes are automatically replicated within their Availability Zone to protect against component failure.

questions.question: Which AWS storage service provides a scalable, elastic file system that can be shared across multiple EC2 instances simultaneously?
questions.explanation: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) provides a scalable, fully managed NFS file system that can be mounted concurrently by multiple EC2 instances across Availability Zones, unlike EBS which attaches to a single instance.

questions.question: Which AWS service distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets such as EC2 instances, containers, and Lambda functions?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets. It supports Application Load Balancer, Network Load Balancer, and Gateway Load Balancer for different use cases.

questions.question: Which AWS service automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances based on demand to maintain performance and minimize cost?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances in response to traffic patterns. It ensures you have the right number of instances to handle the load while minimizing cost during low demand.

questions.question: Which AWS database service is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud that provides up to five times the throughput of standard MySQL?
questions.explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud. It provides up to five times the throughput of standard MySQL and three times the throughput of standard PostgreSQL with high availability and durability.

questions.question: Which AWS service is designed for data warehousing and can analyze large volumes of structured data using SQL?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed data warehouse service that can analyze exabytes of data using SQL. It is optimized for analytical queries across large datasets and integrates with popular BI tools.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides in-memory caching to improve the performance of web applications?
questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache is a fully managed in-memory caching service that supports Redis and Memcached. It improves application performance by storing frequently accessed data in memory, reducing database load and latency.

questions.question: What are AWS Edge Locations primarily used for?
options: Running EC2 instances closer to users
Caching content for Amazon CloudFront to reduce latency
questions.explanation: Edge Locations are sites that Amazon CloudFront uses to cache copies of content closer to end users for faster delivery. There are more Edge Locations than Regions, providing a broad global reach for content delivery.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a platform to deploy and manage applications without worrying about the underlying infrastructure?
questions.explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a PaaS that allows you to quickly deploy and manage applications. You upload your code, and Beanstalk automatically handles capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling, and health monitoring.

questions.question: A company needs to run containers without managing the underlying server infrastructure. Which AWS service should they use?
questions.explanation: AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that works with Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS. It removes the need to provision and manage servers, letting you focus on building applications instead of managing infrastructure.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a fully managed message queuing service that decouples and scales microservices?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications. Messages are stored in a queue until they are processed.

questions.question: Which AWS service sends notifications to subscribers via email, SMS, or HTTP endpoints using a pub/sub messaging model?
questions.explanation: Amazon SNS (Simple Notification Service) is a fully managed pub/sub messaging service that can send notifications to multiple subscribers simultaneously via email, SMS, HTTP, or push notifications to mobile devices.

questions.question: Which S3 storage class is the MOST cost-effective for long-term archival data that is rarely accessed and can tolerate retrieval times of minutes to hours?
questions.explanation: S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier) is designed for long-term archival storage at very low cost. Retrieval times range from minutes to hours, making it ideal for data that is rarely accessed but must be retained.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to run and manage Kubernetes clusters on AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) is a fully managed Kubernetes service that makes it easy to run Kubernetes clusters on AWS without needing to install and operate your own Kubernetes control plane.

questions.question: When selecting an AWS Region for a new deployment, which factors should be considered? (Choose the BEST answer)
options: Only the pricing of EC2 instances
Compliance requirements, latency to users, available services, and pricing
Only the proximity to the development team
Only the number of Availability Zones in the Region
questions.explanation: When selecting a Region, you should consider data residency and compliance requirements, latency to end users, availability of specific services in that Region, and pricing, which can vary between Regions.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a set of tools for building, testing, and deploying applications using CI/CD pipelines?
questions.explanation: AWS CodePipeline is a fully managed continuous delivery service that automates the build, test, and deploy phases of your release process. It enables fast and reliable application updates.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a managed API gateway that enables developers to create, publish, and manage APIs at any scale?
questions.explanation: Amazon API Gateway is a fully managed service that makes it easy for developers to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs at any scale. It handles all the tasks involved in accepting and processing API calls.

questions.question: Which S3 storage class automatically moves data between access tiers based on changing access patterns to optimize costs?
questions.explanation: S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically moves objects between access tiers based on changing access patterns. It monitors access and moves objects that have not been accessed for 30 days to an infrequent access tier, optimizing costs.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides recommendations to help you follow AWS best practices for security, fault tolerance, performance, cost optimization, and service limits?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and provides real-time recommendations across five categories: cost optimization, performance, security, fault tolerance, and service limits to help you follow best practices.

questions.question: Which AWS compute service is BEST suited for running batch processing jobs that can tolerate interruptions?
questions.explanation: EC2 Spot Instances are ideal for batch processing because they offer up to 90% discount and batch jobs can typically be designed to handle interruptions by checkpointing progress and resuming on a new instance.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a VPC subnet?
options: To divide a VPC into smaller network segments with specific routing rules
questions.explanation: A subnet is a range of IP addresses within a VPC. Subnets let you segment your VPC into smaller networks, with public subnets having internet access and private subnets isolated from the internet.

questions.question: Which AWS service enables you to connect multiple VPCs and on-premises networks through a central hub?
questions.explanation: AWS Transit Gateway acts as a cloud router that connects VPCs and on-premises networks through a central hub. This simplifies network architecture by avoiding complex peering relationships between multiple VPCs.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps trace and debug distributed applications by analyzing the path of requests as they travel through multiple services?
questions.explanation: AWS X-Ray helps developers analyze and debug distributed applications. It traces requests as they travel through your application, providing an end-to-end view to identify performance bottlenecks and errors.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to store and retrieve any amount of data at any time from anywhere on the web?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is designed to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere on the web. It provides a simple web services interface that allows you to store and access data with high durability and availability.

questions.question: What is the minimum number of Availability Zones in an AWS Region?
questions.explanation: Every AWS Region has a minimum of three Availability Zones. This ensures customers can build highly available and fault-tolerant applications by distributing resources across multiple isolated locations within each Region.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a way to access AWS services using a command-line interface?
questions.explanation: The AWS CLI (Command Line Interface) is a unified tool that provides a consistent interface for interacting with AWS services from the command line. It enables automation through scripts and direct command execution.

questions.question: A company has unpredictable workloads that can vary from zero to thousands of requests per second. Which compute option would be MOST cost-effective?
options: Amazon EC2 On-Demand with Auto Scaling
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is most cost-effective for unpredictable workloads because you only pay for actual execution time with no charges when idle. Lambda automatically scales from zero to thousands of concurrent requests without any capacity planning.

questions.question: What component allows resources in a public subnet of a VPC to communicate with the internet?
questions.explanation: An Internet Gateway is a VPC component that enables communication between resources in your VPC and the internet. It must be attached to a VPC, and route tables must be configured to direct internet-bound traffic to it.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows resources in a private subnet to access the internet for updates while preventing inbound internet connections?
questions.explanation: A NAT Gateway enables instances in a private subnet to initiate outbound connections to the internet (for software updates, patches, etc.) while preventing unsolicited inbound connections from the internet.

questions.question: Which AWS service can automatically migrate databases to AWS with minimal downtime?
questions.explanation: AWS DMS helps you migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely. The source database remains operational during migration, minimizing downtime. It supports homogeneous (same engine) and heterogeneous (different engine) migrations.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a managed container orchestration service based on Docker?
questions.explanation: Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service) is a fully managed container orchestration service that supports Docker containers. It allows you to run and scale containerized applications on a managed cluster of EC2 instances or using Fargate.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a global network of edge locations for low-latency content delivery?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront uses a global network of edge locations (over 400 points of presence) to cache and deliver content to end users with low latency and high transfer speeds.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to access AWS through a web-based graphical interface?
questions.explanation: The AWS Management Console is a web-based graphical interface for accessing and managing AWS services. It provides a user-friendly way to configure services, view dashboards, and manage resources without command-line knowledge.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides petabyte-scale data transfer using physical devices shipped to and from AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS Snowball is a petabyte-scale data transport service that uses physical devices to transfer large amounts of data into and out of AWS. It is faster and more cost-effective than transferring large datasets over the internet.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to privately connect your VPC to supported AWS services without traversing the public internet?
questions.explanation: VPC Endpoints enable private connections between your VPC and supported AWS services without requiring an Internet Gateway, NAT device, or VPN. Traffic stays within the AWS network, improving security and reducing data transfer costs.

questions.question: Which AWS service enables you to automate operational tasks across AWS resources such as patching, updating agents, and running scripts?
questions.explanation: AWS Systems Manager provides a unified interface for viewing and controlling AWS resources. It automates operational tasks such as patching, inventory collection, and running commands across fleets of instances.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides a visual representation of your AWS costs and usage over time?
questions.explanation: AWS Cost Explorer is a tool that lets you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time. It provides graphs and reports to analyze spending patterns and forecast future costs.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows you to set custom spending alerts and receive notifications when costs exceed a threshold?
questions.explanation: AWS Budgets lets you set custom cost and usage budgets and receive alerts when your costs or usage exceed (or are forecasted to exceed) your budgeted amount. You can set alerts via email or Amazon SNS.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan provides access to a Technical Account Manager (TAM)?
questions.explanation: Only the Enterprise Support plan includes a designated Technical Account Manager (TAM). The TAM provides proactive guidance, architectural reviews, and acts as the primary point of contact for support needs.

questions.question: Which AWS pricing model allows customers to pay for compute capacity by the hour or second with no long-term commitments?
questions.explanation: On-Demand pricing lets you pay for compute capacity by the hour or second (depending on the instance) with no long-term commitments or upfront payments. This is ideal for unpredictable workloads that cannot be interrupted.

questions.question: Which tool helps you estimate the cost of running workloads on AWS before you migrate?
questions.explanation: The AWS Pricing Calculator lets you explore AWS services and create an estimate for the cost of your use cases. It helps you model your solutions before building them and compare the cost of different configurations.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan is available to ALL AWS customers at no additional cost?
questions.explanation: The Basic Support plan is included for all AWS customers at no charge. It provides 24/7 access to customer service, documentation, whitepapers, support forums, and AWS Trusted Advisor core checks.

questions.question: Which AWS pricing feature provides discounts of up to 72% on compute usage in exchange for a commitment to a consistent amount of usage (measured in $/hour) for a 1 or 3-year term?
questions.explanation: Savings Plans offer significant discounts (up to 72%) on compute usage in exchange for committing to a consistent amount of compute usage for a 1 or 3-year term. They are more flexible than Reserved Instances and apply across EC2, Fargate, and Lambda.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan provides a response time of less than 15 minutes for business-critical system down events?
questions.explanation: The Enterprise Support plan provides a response time of less than 15 minutes for business-critical (system down) issues. Business Support provides less than 1 hour for urgent issues, while Developer provides less than 12 hours for system impaired.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS services is available in the AWS Free Tier with no expiration?
options: AWS Lambda (1 million free requests per month)
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda offers 1 million free requests per month as an always-free tier offering with no expiration. EC2, S3, and RDS free tier offers are only available for the first 12 months after account creation.

questions.question: A company wants to compare the total cost of running workloads on-premises versus in AWS. Which concept does this represent?
questions.explanation: Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) is a financial estimate that considers all direct and indirect costs of running infrastructure. Comparing on-premises TCO with AWS costs helps businesses understand the financial benefit of cloud migration.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan provides access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks?
questions.explanation: The Business and Enterprise Support plans provide access to all AWS Trusted Advisor checks. Basic and Developer plans only include core security checks and the service limit check.

questions.question: Which AWS feature allows you to group resources and track costs using custom labels?
questions.explanation: Cost allocation tags are labels that you assign to AWS resources to organize and track costs. After activating tags in the Billing console, you can use them to filter and group costs in Cost Explorer and Cost and Usage Reports.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides the MOST detailed and comprehensive billing data, including hourly line items for every AWS service used?
questions.explanation: The AWS Cost and Usage Report (CUR) provides the most comprehensive and detailed billing data available. It includes hourly or daily line items for each service, usage type, and operation, and can be delivered to an S3 bucket for analysis.

questions.question: Where can AWS customers go to find answers to common questions and engage with the AWS community?
questions.explanation: AWS re:Post (formerly the AWS Knowledge Center and forums) is a community-driven Q&A service where customers can find answers to technical questions, share knowledge, and get help from AWS experts and the community.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of AWS Organizations for billing management?
options: It provides a dedicated TAM for all member accounts
It provides free access to all AWS services
It enables consolidated billing across multiple AWS accounts for volume discounts
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations enables consolidated billing, which combines usage from all member accounts to qualify for volume pricing discounts. It simplifies billing management by providing a single payment method for all accounts.

questions.question: Which AWS Support plan provides Infrastructure Event Management to help plan for large-scale events like product launches?
questions.explanation: Enterprise Support includes Infrastructure Event Management at no additional cost. Business Support customers can access this feature for an additional fee. It provides architectural and scaling guidance for planned events like product launches.

questions.question: What is the pricing model for data transfer INTO AWS from the internet?
questions.explanation: Data transfer into AWS from the internet is free of charge for all AWS services. Customers are only charged for data transferred out of AWS to the internet, which encourages easy migration to the cloud.

questions.question: Which AWS service helps customers plan and execute their migration to AWS by providing a hub for tracking migration progress?
questions.explanation: AWS Migration Hub provides a single location to track the progress of application migrations across multiple AWS and partner solutions. It helps plan, monitor, and manage migrations to the AWS Cloud.
